input: I'd like to revisit a deceptively simple question that I asked in the very first video of this series.
translatedText: Vorrei rivisitare una domanda apparentemente semplice che ho posto nel primissimo video di questa serie.
from_community_srt: I'd like to revisit a deceptively simple question that I asked in the very first video of this

input: What are vectors?
translatedText: Cosa sono i vettori?
from_community_srt: series, What are vectors?

input: Is a two-dimensional vector, for example, fundamentally an arrow on a flat plane that we can describe with coordinates for convenience?
translatedText: Un vettore bidimensionale, ad esempio, è fondamentalmente una freccia su un piano piatto che possiamo descrivere con le coordinate per comodità?
from_community_srt: Is a two-dimensional vector for example, fundamentally an arrow on a flat plane that we can describe with co-ordinates for convenience?

input: Or is it fundamentally that pair of real numbers which is just nicely visualized as an arrow on a flat plane?
translatedText: Oppure si tratta fondamentalmente di quella coppia di numeri reali che è semplicemente ben visualizzata come una freccia su un piano piatto?
from_community_srt: Or, is it fundamentally that pair of real numbers,

input: Or are both of these just manifestations of something deeper?
translatedText: O entrambe sono solo manifestazioni di qualcosa di più profondo?
from_community_srt: which is just nicely visualised as an arrow on a flat plane? Or are both of these just manifestations of something deeper?

input: On the one hand, defining vectors as primarily being a list of numbers feels clear-cut and unambiguous.
translatedText: Da un lato, definire i vettori principalmente come un elenco di numeri sembra chiaro e inequivocabile.
from_community_srt: On the one hand, defining vectors as primarily being a list of numbers feels clear-cut and unambiguous.

input: It makes things like four-dimensional vectors or 100-dimensional vectors sound like real, concrete ideas that you can actually work with.
translatedText: Fa sì che cose come i vettori quadridimensionali o i vettori centodimensionali sembrino idee reali e concrete con cui puoi effettivamente lavorare.
from_community_srt: It makes things like four-dimensional vectors or one hundred-dimensional vectors sound like real, concrete ideas that you can actually work with.

input: When otherwise, an idea like four dimensions is just a vague geometric notion that's difficult to describe without waving your hands a bit.
translatedText: Altrimenti, un'idea come le quattro dimensioni è solo una vaga nozione geometrica difficile da descrivere senza agitare un po' le mani.
from_community_srt: When otherwise, an idea like four dimensions is just a vague, geometric notion that's difficult to describe without waving your hands a bit.

input: But on the other hand, a common sensation for those who actually work with linear algebra, especially as you get more fluent with changing your basis, is that you're dealing with a space that exists independently from the coordinates that you give it, and that coordinates are actually somewhat arbitrary, depending on what you happen to choose as your basis vectors.
translatedText: Ma d'altra parte, una sensazione comune per coloro che lavorano effettivamente con l'algebra lineare, soprattutto quando diventi più fluente nel cambiare le basi, è che hai a che fare con uno spazio che esiste indipendentemente dalle coordinate che gli dai, e tali coordinate sono in realtà alquanto arbitrarie, a seconda di cosa si sceglie come vettori di base.
from_community_srt: But on the other hand, a common sensation for those who actually work with linear algebra, especially as you get more fluent with changing your basis, is that you're dealing with a space that exists independently from the co-ordinates that you give it, and that co-ordinates are actually somewhat arbitrary, depending on what you happen to choose as your basis vectors.

input: Core topics in linear algebra, like determinants and eigenvectors, seem indifferent to your choice of coordinate systems.
translatedText: Gli argomenti fondamentali dell'algebra lineare, come i determinanti e gli autovettori, sembrano indifferenti alla scelta dei sistemi di coordinate.
from_community_srt: Core topics in linear algebra, like determinants and eigenvectors, seem indifferent to your choice of co-ordinate systems.

input: The determinant tells you how much a transformation scales areas, and eigenvectors are the ones that stay on their own span during a transformation.
translatedText: Il determinante indica quanto una trasformazione scala le aree e gli autovettori sono quelli che rimangono nel proprio intervallo durante una trasformazione.
from_community_srt: The determinant tells you how much a transformation scales areas, and eigenvectors are the ones that stay on their own span during a transformation.

input: But both of these properties are inherently spatial, and you can freely change your coordinate system without changing the underlying values of either one.
translatedText: Ma entrambe queste proprietà sono intrinsecamente spaziali e puoi modificare liberamente il tuo sistema di coordinate senza modificare i valori sottostanti di nessuno dei due.
from_community_srt: But both of these properties are inherently spacial, and you can freely change your co-ordinate system without changing the underlying values of either one.

input: But if vectors are not fundamentally lists of real numbers, and if their underlying essence is something more spatial, that just begs the question of what mathematicians mean when they use a word like space or spatial.
translatedText: Ma se i vettori non sono fondamentalmente liste di numeri reali, e se la loro essenza sottostante è qualcosa di più spaziale, ciò solleva semplicemente la questione di cosa intendano i matematici quando usano una parola come spazio o spaziale.
from_community_srt: But, if vectors are fundamentally not lists of real numbers, and if their underlying essence is something more spacial, that just begs the question of what Mathematicians mean when they use a word like space or spacial.

input: To build up to where this is going, I'd actually like to spend the bulk of this video talking about something which is neither an arrow nor a list of numbers, but also has vector-ish qualities – functions.
translatedText: Per capire dove stiamo andando, in realtà mi piacerebbe spendere la maggior parte di questo video parlando di qualcosa che non è né una freccia né un elenco di numeri, ma ha anche qualità vettoriali: funzioni.
from_community_srt: To build up to where this is going, I'd actually like to spend the bulk of this video talking about something which is neither an arrow, nor a list of numbers, but also has vector-ish qualities: functions.

input: You see, there's a sense in which functions are actually just another type of vector.
translatedText: Vedete, c'è un senso in cui le funzioni sono in realtà solo un altro tipo di vettore.
from_community_srt: You see, there's a sense in which functions are actually just another type of vector.

input: In the same way that you can add two vectors together, there's also a sensible notion for adding two functions, f and g, to get a new function, f plus g.
translatedText: Allo stesso modo in cui puoi sommare due vettori insieme, c'è anche un'idea sensata per sommare due funzioni, f e g, per ottenere una nuova funzione, f più g.
from_community_srt: In the same way that you can add two vectors together, there's also a sensible notion for adding two functions, f and g, to get a new function,

input: It's one of those things where you kind of already know what it's going to be, but actually phrasing it is a mouthful.
translatedText: È una di quelle cose in cui sai già cosa sarà, ma in realtà formularlo è un boccone.
from_community_srt: (f+g). It's one of those thing where you kind of already know what it's gonna be, but actually phrasing it is a mouthful.

input: The output of this new function at any given input, like negative four, is the sum of the same input, negative four.
translatedText: L'output di questa nuova funzione per ogni dato input, come meno quattro, è la somma dello stesso input, meno quattro.
from_community_srt: The output of this new function at any given input, like -4, is the sum of the outputs of f and g, when you evaluate them each at that same input,

input: Or more generally, the value of the sum function at any given input x is the sum of the values f of x plus g of x.
translatedText: O più in generale, il valore della funzione somma su ogni dato input x è la somma dei valori f di x più g di x.
from_community_srt: -4. Or, more generally,

input: This is pretty similar to adding vectors coordinate by coordinate, it's just that there are, in a sense, infinitely many coordinates to deal with.
translatedText: Questo è abbastanza simile all'aggiunta di vettori coordinata per coordinata, è solo che ci sono, in un certo senso, infinite coordinate da gestire.
from_community_srt: the value of the sum function at any given input x is the sum of the values of f(x) + g(x). This is pretty similar to adding vectors co-ordinate by co-ordinate, it's just that there are, in a sense,

input: Similarly, there's a sensible notion for scaling a function by a real number, just scale all of the outputs by that number.
translatedText: Allo stesso modo, esiste un'idea sensata per ridimensionare una funzione in base a un numero reale, basta ridimensionare tutti gli output in base a quel numero.
from_community_srt: infinitely many co-ordinates to deal with. Similarly, there's a sensible notion for scaling a function by a real number, just scale all of the outputs by that number.

input: And again, this is analogous to scaling a vector coordinate by coordinate, it just feels like there's infinitely many coordinates.
translatedText: E ancora, questo è analogo al ridimensionamento di un vettore coordinata per coordinata, sembra che ci siano infinite coordinate.
from_community_srt: And again, this is analogous to scaling a vector co-ordinate by co-ordinate, it just feels like there's infinitely many co-ordinates.

input: Now, given that the only thing vectors can really do is get added together or scaled, it feels like we should be able to take the same useful constructs and problem solving techniques of linear algebra that were originally thought about in the context of arrows and space and apply them to functions as well.
translatedText: Ora, dato che l’unica cosa che i vettori possono realmente fare è sommarsi o ridimensionare, sembra che dovremmo essere in grado di prendere gli stessi costrutti utili e le stesse tecniche di risoluzione dei problemi dell’algebra lineare originariamente pensate nel contesto delle frecce e dello spazio. e applicarli anche alle funzioni.
from_community_srt: Now, given that the only thing vectors can really do is get added together or scaled, it feels like we should be able to take the same useful constructs and problem solving techniques of linear algebra, that were originally thought about in the context of arrows in space, and apply them to functions as well.

input: For example, there's a perfectly reasonable notion of a linear transformation for functions, something that takes in one function and turns it into another.
translatedText: Ad esempio, esiste una nozione perfettamente ragionevole di trasformazione lineare per le funzioni, qualcosa che prende una funzione e la trasforma in un'altra.
from_community_srt: For example, there's a perfectly reasonable notion of a linear transformation for functions, something that takes in one function,

input: One familiar example comes from calculus, the derivative.
translatedText: Un esempio familiare viene dal calcolo infinitesimale, la derivata.
from_community_srt: and turns it into another. One familiar example comes from calculus: the derivative.

input: It's something which transforms one function into another function.
translatedText: È qualcosa che trasforma una funzione in un'altra funzione.
from_community_srt: It's something which transforms one function into another function.

input: Sometimes in this context you'll hear these called operators instead of transformations, but the meaning is the same.
translatedText: A volte in questo contesto sentirai questi chiamati operatori invece di trasformazioni, ma il significato è lo stesso.
from_community_srt: Sometimes in this context, you'll hear these called operators instead of transformations, but the meaning is the same.

input: A natural question you might want to ask is what it means for a transformation of functions to be linear.
translatedText: Una domanda naturale che potresti porre è cosa significa che una trasformazione di funzioni è lineare.
from_community_srt: A natural question you might want to ask, is what it means for a transformation of functions to be linear.

input: The formal definition of linearity is relatively abstract and symbolically driven compared to the way that I first talked about it in chapter 3 of this series.
translatedText: La definizione formale di linearità è relativamente astratta e simbolicamente guidata rispetto al modo in cui ne ho parlato per la prima volta nel capitolo 3 di questa serie.
from_community_srt: The formal definition of linearity is relatively abstract and symbolically driven compared to the way that I first talked about it in chapter 3 of this series,

input: But the reward of abstractness is that we'll get something general enough to apply to functions as well as arrows.
translatedText: Ma il vantaggio dell'astrattezza è che otterremo qualcosa di abbastanza generale da poter essere applicato sia alle funzioni che alle frecce.
from_community_srt: but the reward of abstractness is that we'll get something general enough to apply to functions,

input: A transformation is linear if it satisfies two properties, commonly called additivity and scaling.
translatedText: Una trasformazione è lineare se soddisfa due proprietà, comunemente chiamate additività e scaling.
from_community_srt: as well as arrows. A transformation is linear if it satisfies two properties, commonly called additivity and scaling.

input: Additivity means that if you add two vectors, v and w, then apply a transformation to their sum, you get the same result as if you added the transformed versions of v and w.
translatedText: L'additività significa che se aggiungi due vettori, v e w, quindi applichi una trasformazione alla loro somma, ottieni lo stesso risultato che otterresti se aggiungessi le versioni trasformate di v e w.
from_community_srt: Additivity means that if you add two vectors, v and w, then apply a transformation to their sum, you get the same result as if you added the transformed versions of v and w.

input: The scaling property is that when you scale a vector v by some number, then apply the transformation, you get the same ultimate vector as if you scaled the transformed version of v by that same amount.
translatedText: La proprietà di ridimensionamento è che quando si ridimensiona un vettore v di un certo numero, quindi si applica la trasformazione, si ottiene lo stesso vettore finale come se si ridimensionasse la versione trasformata di v della stessa quantità.
from_community_srt: The scaling property is that when you scale a vector v by some number, then apply the transformation, you get the same ultimate vector as if you scale the transformed version of v by that same amount.

input: The way you'll often hear this described is that linear transformations preserve the operations of vector addition and scalar multiplication.
translatedText: Il modo in cui sentirai spesso descrivere questo è che le trasformazioni lineari preservano le operazioni di addizione vettoriale e moltiplicazione scalare.
from_community_srt: The way you'll often hear this described is that linear transformations preserve the operations

input: The idea of gridlines remaining parallel and evenly spaced that I've talked about in past videos is really just an illustration of what these two properties mean in the specific case of points in 2D space.
translatedText: L'idea delle linee della griglia che rimangono parallele e spaziate uniformemente di cui ho parlato nei video precedenti è in realtà solo un esempio di cosa significano queste due proprietà nel caso specifico dei punti nello spazio 2D.
from_community_srt: of vector addition and scalar multiplication. The idea of gridlines remaining parallel and evenly spaced is that I've talked about in past videos is really just an illustration of what these two properties mean in the specific case of 2D points in space.

input: One of the most important consequences of these properties, which makes matrix vector multiplication possible, is that a linear transformation is completely described by where it takes the basis vectors.
translatedText: Una delle conseguenze più importanti di queste proprietà, che rende possibile la moltiplicazione dei vettori di matrice, è che una trasformazione lineare è completamente descritta da dove prende i vettori di base.
from_community_srt: One of the most important consequences of these properties, which makes matrix-vector multiplication possible, is that a linear transformation is completely described by where it takes the basis vectors.

input: Since any vector can be expressed by scaling and adding the basis vectors in some way, finding the transformed version of a vector comes down to scaling and adding the transformed versions of the basis vectors in that same way.
translatedText: Poiché qualsiasi vettore può essere espresso ridimensionando e sommando i vettori base in qualche modo, trovare la versione trasformata di un vettore si riduce a ridimensionare e sommando le versioni trasformate dei vettori base nello stesso modo.
from_community_srt: Since any vector can be expressed by scaling and adding the basis vectors in some way, finding the transformed version of a vector comes down to scaling and adding the transformed versions of the basis vectors in that same way.

input: As you'll see in just a moment, this is as true for functions as it is for arrows.
translatedText: Come vedrai tra poco, questo è vero sia per le funzioni che per le frecce.
from_community_srt: As you'll see in a moment, this is as true for functions as it is for arrows.

input: For example, calculus students are always using the fact that the derivative is additive and has the scaling property, even if they haven't heard it phrased that way.
translatedText: Ad esempio, gli studenti di calcolo sfruttano sempre il fatto che la derivata è additiva e ha la proprietà di scala, anche se non l'hanno mai sentita formulata in questo modo.
from_community_srt: For example, calculus students are always using the fact that the derivative is additive and has the scaling property,

input: If you add two functions, then take the derivative, it's the same as first taking the derivative of each one separately, then adding the result.
translatedText: Se sommi due funzioni e poi prendi la derivata, è come prendere prima la derivata di ciascuna separatamente e poi sommare il risultato.
from_community_srt: even f they haven't heard it phrased that way. If you add two functions, then take the derivative, it's the same as first taking the derivative of each one separately,

input: Similarly, if you scale a function, then take the derivative, it's the same as first taking the derivative, then scaling the result.
translatedText: Allo stesso modo, se si scala una funzione e poi si calcola la derivata, è come prendere prima la derivata e poi ridimensionare il risultato.
from_community_srt: then adding the result. Similarly, if you scale a function, then take the derivative, it's the same as first taking the derivative, then scaling the result.

input: To really drill in the parallel, let's see what it might look like to describe the derivative with a matrix.
translatedText: Per approfondire davvero il parallelo, vediamo come potrebbe essere descrivere la derivata con una matrice.
from_community_srt: To really drill in the parallel, let's see what it might look like to describe the derivative with a matrix.

input: This will be a little tricky, since function spaces have a tendency to be infinite dimensional, but I think this exercise is actually quite satisfying.
translatedText: Questo sarà un po' complicato, dal momento che gli spazi funzionali hanno la tendenza ad avere una dimensione infinita, ma penso che questo esercizio sia in realtà abbastanza soddisfacente.
from_community_srt: This will be a little tricky, since function spaces have a tendency to be infinite-dimensional, but I think this exercise is actually quite satisfying.

input: Let's limit ourselves to polynomials, things like x squared plus 3x plus 5, or 4x to the seventh minus 5x squared.
translatedText: Limitiamoci ai polinomi, cose come x al quadrato più 3x più 5, o 4x alla settima meno 5x al quadrato.
from_community_srt: Let's limit ourselves to polynomials, things like x^2 + 3x + 5 or 4x^7 - 5x^2.

input: Each of the polynomials in our space will only have finitely many terms, but the full space is going to include polynomials with arbitrarily large degree.
translatedText: Ciascuno dei polinomi nel nostro spazio avrà solo un numero finito di termini, ma l'intero spazio includerà polinomi con grado arbitrariamente grande.
from_community_srt: Each of the polynomials in our space will only have finitely many terms, but the full space is going to include polynomials with arbitrarily large degree.

input: The first thing we need to do is give coordinates to this space, which requires choosing a basis.
translatedText: La prima cosa che dobbiamo fare è dare le coordinate a questo spazio, il che richiede la scelta di una base.
from_community_srt: The first thing we need to do is give co-ordinates to this space,

input: Since polynomials are already written down as the sum of scaled powers of the variable x, it's pretty natural to just choose pure powers of x as the basis function.
translatedText: Poiché i polinomi sono già scritti come la somma delle potenze scalate della variabile x, è abbastanza naturale scegliere semplicemente le potenze pure di x come funzione base.
from_community_srt: which requires choosing a basis. Since polynomials are already written down as the sum of scaled powers of the variable x, it's pretty natural to just choose pure powers of x as the basis function.

input: In other words, our first basis function will be the constant function, b0 of x equals 1.
translatedText: In altre parole, la nostra prima funzione base sarà la funzione costante, b0 di x è uguale a 1.
from_community_srt: In other words, our first basis function will be the constant function,

input: The second basis function will be b1 of x equals x, then b2 of x equals x squared, then b3 of x equals x cubed, and so on.
translatedText: La seconda funzione di base sarà b1 di x uguale a x, quindi b2 di x uguale a x al quadrato, quindi b3 di x uguale a x al cubo e così via.
from_community_srt: b_0(x) = 1. The second basis function will be b_1(x) = x, then b_2(x)=x^2, then b_3(x)=x^3,

input: The role that these basis functions serve will be similar to the roles of i-hat, j-hat, and k-hat in the world of vectors as arrows.
translatedText: Il ruolo svolto da queste funzioni di base sarà simile ai ruoli di i-hat, j-hat e k-hat nel mondo dei vettori come frecce.
from_community_srt: and so on. The role that these basis functions serve will be similar to the roles of i-hat, j-hat and k-hat in the world of vectors as arrows.

input: Since our polynomials can have arbitrarily large degree, this set of basis functions is infinite.
translatedText: Poiché i nostri polinomi possono avere grado arbitrariamente grande, questo insieme di funzioni di base è infinito.
from_community_srt: Since our polynomials can have arbitrarily large degree, this set of basis functions is infinite.

input: But that's okay, it just means that when we treat our polynomials as vectors, they're going to have infinitely many coordinates.
translatedText: Ma va bene, significa solo che quando trattiamo i nostri polinomi come vettori, avranno infinite coordinate.
from_community_srt: But that's okay, it just means that when we treat out polynomials as vectors, they're going to have infinitely many co-ordinates.

input: A polynomial like x squared plus 3x plus 5, for example, would be described with the coordinates 5, 3, 1, then infinitely many zeros.
translatedText: Un polinomio come x al quadrato più 3x più 5, ad esempio, verrebbe descritto con le coordinate 5, 3, 1, quindi infiniti zeri.
from_community_srt: A polynomial like x^2 + 3x + 5, for example, would be described with the co-ordiantes 5, 3, 1, then infinitely many zeros.

input: You'd read this as saying that it's 5 times the first basis function, plus 3 times that second basis function, plus 1 times the third basis function, and then none of the other basis functions should be added from that point on.
translatedText: Lo leggeresti come se dicesse che è 5 volte la prima funzione di base, più 3 volte la seconda funzione di base, più 1 volta la terza funzione di base, e quindi nessuna delle altre funzioni di base dovrebbe essere aggiunta da quel punto in poi.
from_community_srt: You'd read this as saying it's 5 times the first basis function, plus 3 times that second basis function, plus 1 times the third basis function, and then none of the other basis functions should be added from that point on.

input: The polynomial 4x to the seventh minus 5x squared would have the coordinates 0, 0, negative 5, 0, 0, 0, 0, 4, then an infinite string of zeros.
translatedText: Il polinomio 4x alla settima meno 5x al quadrato avrebbe le coordinate 0, 0, negativo 5, 0, 0, 0, 0, 4, quindi una stringa infinita di zeri.
from_community_srt: The polynomial 4x^7 - 5x^2 would have the co-ordinates 0, 0, -5, 0, 0, 0, 0, 4, then an infinite string of zeros.

input: In general, since every individual polynomial has only finitely many terms, its coordinates will be some finite string of numbers with an infinite tail of zeros.
translatedText: In generale, poiché ogni singolo polinomio ha solo un numero finito di termini, le sue coordinate saranno una stringa finita di numeri con una coda infinita di zeri.
from_community_srt: In general, since every individual polynomial has only finitely many terms, it's co-ordinates will be some finite string of numbers,

input: In this coordinate system, the derivative is described with an infinite matrix that's mostly full of zeros, but which has the positive integers counting down on this offset diagonal.
translatedText: In questo sistema di coordinate, la derivata è descritta con una matrice infinita che è per lo più piena di zeri, ma che ha i numeri interi positivi che contano su questa diagonale di offset.
from_community_srt: with an infinite tail of zeros. In this co-ordinate system, the derivative is described with an infinite matrix, that's mostly full of zeors, but which has the positive integers counting down on this offset diagonal.

input: I'll talk about how you could find this matrix in just a moment, but the best way to get a feel for it is to just watch it in action.
translatedText: Parlerò di come potresti trovare questa matrice tra un momento, ma il modo migliore per farti un'idea è semplicemente guardarla in azione.
from_community_srt: I'll talk about how you could find this matrix in just a moment, but the best way to get a feel for it, is to just watch it in action.

input: Take the coordinates representing the polynomial x cubed plus 5x squared plus 4x plus 5, then put those coordinates on the right of the matrix.
translatedText: Prendi le coordinate che rappresentano il polinomio x al cubo più 5x al quadrato più 4x più 5, quindi inserisci quelle coordinate a destra della matrice.
from_community_srt: Take the co-ordinates representing the polynomial x^3 + 5x^2 + 4x + 5, then put those co-ordinates on the right of the matrix.

input: The only term that contributes to the first coordinate of the result is 1 times 4, which means the constant term in the result will be 4.
translatedText: L'unico termine che contribuisce alla prima coordinata del risultato è 1 per 4, il che significa che il termine costante nel risultato sarà 4.
from_community_srt: The only term which contributes to the first co-ordinate of the result is 1x4, which means the constant term in the result will be 4.

input: This corresponds to the fact that the derivative of 4x is the constant 4.
translatedText: Ciò corrisponde al fatto che la derivata di 4x è la costante 4.
from_community_srt: This corresponds to the fact that the derivative of 4x is the constant 4.

input: The only term contributing to the second coordinate of the matrix vector product is 2 times 5, which means the coefficient in front of x in the derivative is 10.
translatedText: L'unico termine che contribuisce alla seconda coordinata del prodotto vettoriale della matrice è 2 volte 5, il che significa che il coefficiente davanti a x nella derivata è 10.
from_community_srt: The only term contributing to the second co-ordinate of the matrix-vector product is 2x5, which means the coefficient in front of x in the derivative is 10.

input: That one corresponds to the derivative of 5x squared.
translatedText: Quello corrisponde alla derivata di 5x al quadrato.
from_community_srt: That one corresponds to the derivative of 5x^2.

input: Similarly, the third coordinate in the matrix vector product comes down to taking 3 times 1.
translatedText: Allo stesso modo, la terza coordinata nel prodotto vettoriale della matrice si riduce a prendere 3 volte 1.
from_community_srt: Similarly, the third co-ordinate in the matrix-vector product comes down to taking 3x1.

input: This one corresponds to the derivative of x cubed being 3x squared.
translatedText: Questo corrisponde alla derivata di x al cubo essendo 3x al quadrato.
from_community_srt: This one corresponds to the derivative of x^3 being 3x^2.

input: And after that, it'll be nothing but zeros.
translatedText: E dopo non ci saranno altro che zero.
from_community_srt: And after that,

input: What makes this possible is that the derivative is linear.
translatedText: Ciò che lo rende possibile è che la derivata è lineare.
from_community_srt: it'll be nothing but zeros. What makes this possible is that the derivative is linear.

input: And for those of you who like to pause and ponder, you could construct this matrix by taking the derivative of each basis function and putting the coordinates of the results in each column.
translatedText: E per quelli di voi che amano fermarsi a riflettere, potreste costruire questa matrice prendendo la derivata di ciascuna funzione di base e inserendo le coordinate dei risultati in ciascuna colonna.
from_community_srt: And, for those of you who like to pause and ponder, you could construct this matrix by taking the derivative of each basis function,

input: So, surprisingly, matrix vector multiplication and taking a derivative, which at first seem like completely different animals, are both just really members of the same family.
translatedText: Quindi, sorprendentemente, la moltiplicazione di vettori di matrice e la derivata, che a prima vista sembrano animali completamente diversi, sono entrambi in realtà membri della stessa famiglia.
from_community_srt: and putting the co-ordinates of the results in each column. So, surprisingly, matrix-vector multiplication and taking a derivative, which at first seem like completely different animals, are both just really members of the same family.

input: In fact, most of the concepts I've talked about in this series with respect to vectors as arrows in space, things like the dot product or eigenvectors, have direct analogs in the world of functions, though sometimes they go by different names, things like inner product or eigenfunction.
translatedText: In effetti, la maggior parte dei concetti di cui ho parlato in questa serie rispetto ai vettori come frecce nello spazio, cose come il prodotto scalare o gli autovettori, hanno analogie dirette nel mondo delle funzioni, anche se a volte hanno nomi diversi, cose come prodotto interno o autofunzione.
from_community_srt: In fact, most of the concepts I've talked about in this series with respect to vectors as arrows in space, things like the dot product or eigenvectors, have direct analogues in the world of functions. Though sometimes they go by different names, things like 'inner product' or 'eigenfunction'.

input: So back to the question of what is a vector.
translatedText: Quindi torniamo alla domanda su cosa sia un vettore.
from_community_srt: So, back to the question of what is a vector.

input: The point I want to make here is that there are lots of vectorish things in math.
translatedText: Il punto che voglio sottolineare qui è che ci sono molte cose vettoriali in matematica.

input: As long as you're dealing with a set of objects where there's a reasonable notion of scaling and adding, whether that's a set of arrows in space, lists of numbers, functions, or whatever other crazy thing you choose to define, all of the tools developed in linear algebra regarding vectors, linear transformations and all that stuff, should be able to apply.
translatedText: Finché hai a che fare con un insieme di oggetti per cui esiste una nozione ragionevole di scala e addizione, che si tratti di un insieme di frecce nello spazio, elenchi di numeri, funzioni o qualsiasi altra cosa folle che scegli di definire, tutto dovrebbero essere in grado di applicare gli strumenti sviluppati nell'algebra lineare riguardanti i vettori, le trasformazioni lineari e tutto il resto.
from_community_srt: The point I want to make here is that there are lots of vector-ish things in maths, as long as you're dealing with a set of objects where there's a reasonable notion of scaling and adding, whether that's a set of arrows in space, lists of numbers, functions or whatever other crazy thing you choose to define, all of the tools developed in linear algebra regarding vectors, linear transformations, and all that stuff,

input: Take a moment to imagine yourself right now as a mathematician developing the theory of linear algebra.
translatedText: Prenditi un momento per immaginarti adesso nei panni di un matematico che sviluppa la teoria dell'algebra lineare.
from_community_srt: should be able to apply. Take a moment to imagine yourself right now, as a mathematician developing the theory of linear algebra.

input: You want all of the definitions and discoveries of your work to apply to all of the vectorish things in full generality, not just to one specific case.
translatedText: Vuoi che tutte le definizioni e le scoperte del tuo lavoro si applichino a tutte le cose vettoriali in piena generalità, non solo a un caso specifico.
from_community_srt: You want all of the definitions and discoveries of your work to apply to all of the vector-ish things in full generality,

input: These sets of vectorish things, like arrows or lists of numbers or functions, are called vector spaces.
translatedText: Questi insiemi di cose vettoriali, come frecce o elenchi di numeri o funzioni, sono chiamati spazi vettoriali.
from_community_srt: not just to one specific case. These sets of vector-ish things, like arrows or lists of numbers or functions,

input: And what you as the mathematician might want to do is say, hey everyone, I don't want to have to think about all the different types of crazy vector spaces that you all might come up with.
translatedText: E quello che voi matematici potreste voler fare è dire, ciao a tutti, non voglio dover pensare a tutti i diversi tipi di pazzi spazi vettoriali che potreste inventare.
from_community_srt: are called vector spaces, and what you as the mathematician might want to do is say, "Hey everyone! I don't want to think about all the different types of crazy vector spaces that you all might come up with,

input: So what you do is establish a list of rules that vector addition and scaling have to abide by.
translatedText: Quindi quello che fai è stabilire un elenco di regole a cui devono attenersi l'aggiunta e il ridimensionamento dei vettori.
from_community_srt: so what you do is establish a list of rules that vector addition and scaling have to abide by.

input: These rules are called axioms, and in the modern theory of linear algebra, there are eight axioms that any vector space must satisfy if all of the theory and constructs that we've discovered are going to apply.
translatedText: Queste regole sono chiamate assiomi e nella moderna teoria dell'algebra lineare ci sono otto assiomi che qualsiasi spazio vettoriale deve soddisfare se tutta la teoria e i costrutti che abbiamo scoperto possono essere applicati.
from_community_srt: These rules are called axioms, and in the modern theory of linear algebra, there are 8 axioms that any vector space must satisfy, if all of the theory and constructs that we've discovered are going to apply.

input: I'll leave them on the screen here for anyone who wants to pause and ponder, but basically it's just a checklist to make sure that the notions of vector addition and scalar multiplication do the things that you'd expect them to do.
translatedText: Li lascerò sullo schermo qui per chiunque voglia fermarsi e riflettere, ma fondamentalmente è solo una lista di controllo per assicurarsi che le nozioni di addizione vettoriale e moltiplicazione scalare facciano le cose che ti aspetteresti che facciano.
from_community_srt: I'll leave them on the screen here for anyone who wants to pause and ponder, but basically, it's just a checklist, to make sure that the notions of vector addition and scalar multiplication do the things that you'd expect them to do.

input: These axioms are not so much fundamental rules of nature as they are an interface between you, the mathematician, discovering results, and other people who might want to apply those results to new sorts of vector spaces.
translatedText: Questi assiomi non sono tanto regole fondamentali della natura quanto un'interfaccia tra te, il matematico, che scopri i risultati e altre persone che potrebbero voler applicare tali risultati a nuovi tipi di spazi vettoriali.
from_community_srt: These axioms are not so much fundamental rules of nature, as they are an interface between you, the mathematician discovering results, and other people who might want to apply those results to new sorts of vectors spaces.

input: If, for example, someone defines some crazy type of vector space, like the set of all pi creatures with some definition of adding and scaling pi creatures, these axioms are like a checklist of things that they need to verify about their definitions before they can start applying the results of linear algebra.
translatedText: Se, ad esempio, qualcuno definisce un tipo assurdo di spazio vettoriale, come l'insieme di tutte le creature pi greco con una certa definizione di aggiunta e ridimensionamento delle creature pi greco, questi assiomi sono come una lista di cose che devono verificare riguardo alle loro definizioni prima di poterlo fare. iniziare ad applicare i risultati dell'algebra lineare.
from_community_srt: If, for example, someone defines some crazy type of vector space, like the set of all pi creatures, with some definition of adding and scaling pi creatures, these axioms are like a checklist of things that they need to verify about their definitions, before they can start applying the results of linear algebra.

input: And you, as the mathematician, never have to think about all the possible crazy vector spaces people might define.
translatedText: E tu, come matematico, non devi mai pensare a tutti i possibili spazi vettoriali folli che le persone potrebbero definire.
from_community_srt: And you as the mathematician,

input: You just have to prove your results in terms of these axioms so anyone whose definitions satisfy those axioms can happily apply your results, even if you never thought about their situation.
translatedText: Devi solo dimostrare i tuoi risultati in termini di questi assiomi in modo che chiunque le cui definizioni soddisfino tali assiomi possa applicare felicemente i tuoi risultati, anche se non hai mai pensato alla loro situazione.
from_community_srt: never have to think about all the possible crazy vector spaces people might define, you just have to prove your results in terms of these axioms, so anyone who's definitions satisfy those axioms can happily apply you results,

input: As a consequence, you'd tend to phrase all of your results pretty abstractly, which is to say, only in terms of these axioms, rather than centering on a specific type of vector, like arrows in space or functions.
translatedText: Di conseguenza, tenderesti a esprimere tutti i tuoi risultati in modo piuttosto astratto, vale a dire solo in termini di questi assiomi, piuttosto che concentrarti su un tipo specifico di vettore, come le frecce nello spazio o le funzioni.
from_community_srt: even if you never thought about their situation. As a consequence, you'd tend to phrase all of your results pretty abstractly, which is to say, only in terms of these axioms, rather than centring on a specific type of vector,

input: For example, this is why just about every textbook you'll find will define linear transformations in terms of additivity and scaling, rather than talking about gridlines remaining parallel and evenly spaced.
translatedText: Ad esempio, questo è il motivo per cui quasi tutti i libri di testo che troverai definiranno le trasformazioni lineari in termini di additività e scala, invece di parlare di linee della griglia che rimangono parallele e spaziate uniformemente.
from_community_srt: like arrows in space, or functions. For example, this is why just about every textbook you'll find will define linear transformations in terms of additivity and scaling, rather than talking about gridlines remaining parallel and evenly spaced, even though the latter is more intuitive,

input: Even though the latter is more intuitive, and at least in my view, more helpful for first-time learners, even if it is specific to one situation.
translatedText: Anche se quest'ultimo è più intuitivo e, almeno a mio avviso, più utile per gli studenti alle prime armi, anche se è specifico per una situazione.
from_community_srt: and at least in my view, more helpful for first time learners, even if it is specific to one situation.

input: So the mathematician's answer to what are vectors is to just ignore the question.
translatedText: Quindi la risposta del matematico a cosa sono i vettori è semplicemente ignorare la domanda.
from_community_srt: So the mathematicians answer to "what are vectors?" is to just ignore the question.

input: In the modern theory, the form that vectors take doesn't really matter.
translatedText: Nella teoria moderna, la forma che assumono i vettori non ha molta importanza.
from_community_srt: In the modern theory, the form that vectors take doesn't really matter,

input: Arrows, lists of numbers, functions, pi creatures, really, it can be anything, so long as there's some notion of adding and scaling vectors that follows these rules.
translatedText: Frecce, elenchi di numeri, funzioni, creature pi greco, in realtà, può essere qualsiasi cosa, purché ci sia qualche nozione di aggiunta e ridimensionamento dei vettori che segua queste regole.
from_community_srt: arrows, lists of numbers, functions, pi creatures, really it can be anything so long as there is some notion of adding and scaling vectors that follows these rules.

input: It's like asking what the number 3 really is.
translatedText: È come chiedere cosa sia veramente il numero 3.
from_community_srt: It's like asking what the number 'three' really is.

input: Whenever it comes up concretely, it's in the context of some triplet of things, but in math, it's treated as an abstraction for all possible triplets of things, and lets you reason about all possible triplets using a single idea.
translatedText: Ogni volta che emerge concretamente, è nel contesto di una tripletta di cose, ma in matematica viene trattata come un'astrazione per tutte le possibili terzine di cose e ti consente di ragionare su tutte le possibili terzine utilizzando una singola idea.
from_community_srt: Whenever it comes up concretely, it's in the context of some triplet of things, but in maths, it's treated as an abstraction for all possible triplets of things, and lets you reason about all possible triplets, using a single idea.

input: Same goes with vectors, which have many embodiments, but math abstracts them all into a single, intangible notion of a vector space.
translatedText: Lo stesso vale con i vettori, che hanno molte incarnazioni, ma la matematica li astrae tutti in un’unica, intangibile nozione di spazio vettoriale.
from_community_srt: Same goes with vectors, which have many embodiments, but maths abstracts them all into a single, intangible notion of a vector space.

input: But, as anyone watching this series knows, I think it's better to begin reasoning about vectors in a concrete, visualizable setting, like 2D space, with arrows rooted at the origin.
translatedText: Ma, come sa chiunque guardi questa serie, penso che sia meglio iniziare a ragionare sui vettori in un ambiente concreto e visualizzabile, come lo spazio 2D, con le frecce radicate nell'origine.
from_community_srt: But, as anyone watching this series knows, I think it's better to begin reasoning about vectors in a concrete, visualisable setting, like 2D space with arrows rooted at the origin.

input: But as you learn more linear algebra, know that these tools apply much more generally, and that this is the underlying reason why textbooks and lectures tend to be phrased, well, abstractly.
translatedText: Ma man mano che impari di più sull’algebra lineare, sappi che questi strumenti si applicano in modo molto più generale, e che questo è il motivo di fondo per cui i libri di testo e le lezioni tendono ad essere formulati, beh, in modo astratto.
from_community_srt: But as you learn more linear algebra, know that these tools apply much more generally, and that this is the underlying reason why textbooks and lectures tend to be phrased,
